menuTree.title: Main menu
menuTree.description: The top level menu and (optionally) any submenus just below it

soloScreens.title: Special Solo Screens
soloScreens.description:
List of special stand-alone screens.  These screens cannot be reached with the navigation keys and will only be shown when events trigger their display (so each should have an associated `showOnEvent` or it will never show).  The Esc key will exit these screens and return to the home menu.  
Examples are a file transfer status screen and screens for temporary notices such as a boot screen. 
Each screen is an object, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}. 
The order of the solo screens doesn't matter since they are not navigable siblings.  They can only return to the home screen.

menuItem.title: Menu item
menuItem.description: Menu tree branch or leaf.  Specify "menuType" first to determine what other properties are required.

menuType.title: Menu type
menuType.description:
The other settings depend on the "menuType" selected, so set "menuType" first.  A branch has submenus and a leaf has associated screens of data and/or text. 
The data screens under a "leaf_wrap" will wrap around at the ends when navigating through the list.  The data screens under a "leaf_no_wrap" menu will not wrap around.

menuTitle.description:
Menu name to be shown on the LCD. 
Default position is centered, but you can override that by using the position/justify property.  Row and column are ignored and are set by the firmware.  When it is shown as a submenu (on the bottom row) then it will be centered.  If left/right arrows are used to navigate submenus, keep the string length <= 18 to leave room for the arrows. 
Requires a text object, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

menuId.title: Unique id
menuId.description: Unique text id for reference locally and by host.  Alphanumeric with no spaces or special characters.

submenus.description:
A list of submenus below this menu tree branch.  The submenus will be presented in the order they are in the file.  
Each submenu is an object with multiple parameters, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

menuType.title: Menu type
menuType.description:
The other settings depend on the "menuType" selected, so set "menuType" first.  A branch has submenus and a leaf has associated screens of data and/or text. 
The data screens under a "leaf_wrap" will wrap around at the ends when navigating through the list.  The data screens under a "leaf_no_wrap" menu will not wrap around.

menuTitle.description: The manifest branch level creates a menu for each manifest, with a fixed title based on the manifest version string from the manifest record.

menuId.title: Unique id
menuId.description: Unique text id for reference locally and by host.  Alphanumeric with no spaces or special characters.

submenus.description:
A list of submenus below this menu tree branch.  The submenus will be presented in the order they are in the file.  
Each submenu is an object with multiple parameters, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

oneOf.description: Special type of menu branch.  There will be a variable number of menus at this level, and the titles will be derived from the ManifVer field of each manifest record.

menuType.title: Menu type
menuType.description:
The other settings depend on the "menuType" selected, so set "menuType" first.  A branch has submenus and a leaf has associated screens of data and/or text. 
The data screens under a "leaf_wrap" will wrap around at the ends when navigating through the list.  The data screens under a "leaf_no_wrap" menu will not wrap around.

menuTitle.description:
Menu name to be shown on the LCD. 
Default position is centered, but you can override that by using the position/justify property. 
Requires a text object, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

menuId.title: Unique id
menuId.description: Unique text id for reference locally and by host.  Alphanumeric with no spaces or special characters.

screens.description:
List of screens available under this menu tree leaf.  The screens will be presented in the order they are in the file. 
Each screen is an object, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

screen.title: LCD Screen definition
screen.description: A screen is made up of text strings and variables.  It should contain one or the other or both.  An empty screen will be ignored.

screenId.title: Unique id
screenId.description: Unique text id for reference locally and by host.  Alphanumeric with no spaces or special characters.

showIf.description: If specified, the screen will only show if one or more of the conditions are true.

dontShowIf.description: If specified, the screen will NOT show if any of the conditions are true.  This overrides the showIf conditions.

F1action.description: The action that will be executed if the F1 key is pressed while on this screen.

F2action.description: The action that will be executed if the F2 key is pressed while on this screen.

EscAction.description: The action that will be executed if the Esc key is pressed while on this screen.

EnterAction.description: The action that will be executed if the Enter key is pressed while on this screen.

ackRequired.title: Manual keypad acknowledgment required
ackRequired.description:
If true then normal automatic transitions to other screens will be disabled.  This makes sure that the user sees the screen and presses a button to leave. 

For orphan screens (with no parent menu) the only way to leave is to press the Esc key, so this can be combined with the EscAction showModeScreen to jump to the screen for the current mode upon exit.

textBlocks.title: Text Blocks
textBlocks.description:
Array of zero or more fixed text objects (text and position) to place on the LCD.  
Each text object should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

variables.title: Variables
variables.description:
Array of zero or more variables to display on the screen. 
Each variable is an object, so it should be wrapped in curly braces {}.

items.title: Variable
items.description: Object specifies the variable, format and screen position

variable.title: Variable Definition
variable.description: Variable specification.  The settings depend on the "varType" selected, so set "varType" first.

pnVal.description: PN is a special case, with units always shown, and no other text allowed on the same line to ensure that the value isn't modified.

useThouSep.description: If true, a thousands separator (comma, point or space) will be used between groups of 3 digits.  The separator used is set as a global setting "thousandsChar" in "menuSetParams"

showDuringZero.description: If true, the PN number will be shown during zeroing.  If false, the PN number will be replaced by the "zeroingStr" string.  The default is false.

showDuringSpan.description: If true, the PN number will be shown during the span check at the end of zeroing.  If false, the PN number will be replaced by the "zeroSpanCheckStr" string.  The default is false.

dateVal.description: All dates are displayed in local time, except for the sysDate (UTC system date)

dateFmt.description: Date format.  Default of dd.mm.yyyy is used if not specified.

timeVal.description: All times are displayed in local time, except for the sysTime (UTC system time)

spaceBeforeUnits.description: If true, a space will be inserted between the value and units
If true, a space will be inserted between the value and units

varType.description: String variables such as messages, file names, version info
Percentage variable such as progress indicators

showUnits.description: If showUnits is true (the default), the percent symbol will be added, e.g.- 99%

varType.description: Gas flow rates in L/min or mL/min

showUnits.description:
The units (`L/min` or `mL/min` will be shown (upper or lower case liters as selectect). 

If you would like a different version (such as L/m) remember that you can use fixed text to add your own units and turn off the automatic units.

flowUnits.description:
This will set the scaling, regardless of whether the units are actually shown or not.  The default is "l/min".

L/min will be shown as a fixed five digit float 9.999. 

mL/min will be shown as an integer with up to 4 digits.

spaceBeforeUnits.description: If true, a space will be inserted between the value and units

varType.description: Pressures and vacuums in mbar.  Vacuums are only valid during a leak test.

pressUnits.description: The scaling will always be the same, but there are several equivalent units to choose from.  Or set units to `none` to not show any

spaceBeforeUnits.description: If true, a space will be inserted between the value and units

varType.description: Miscellaneous unit-less float values such as the dilution factor
Single character flag such as the PN validity flags
State variables such as the bench mode and submode and leak test status.  These get translated into strings set in the "menuSetParams".

showCount.title: Show countdown timer for bench Submodes
showCount.description: If this is set to true and the submode has a countdown timer, then it will be shown after the submode string and a colon, for example "Rinsing: 5s".

spaceBeforeCount.description: If true, a space will be inserted between the colon ':' and the countdown timer

floatFmt.description: The float format is used for percentage progress indicators such as warmup.

showDuringZero.title: Show when bench is Zeroing
showDuringZero.description: This currently only applies to the pnValidity state.  If true then the zeroing submode will show in the place of the PN validity state strings during the zeroing before measurement.  The default is false.

position.title: LCD position
position.description: Optional coordinates and justification to specify the position on the screen

row.title: LCD Row
row.description: Top row is 0.  Default of 0 will be used if not specified or if the row is fixed by the usage (e.g.- menu title moves from top to bottom row if a sub menu)

column.title: LCD Column
column.description: Leftmost column is 0.  Default of 0 (or 19 for right justification) will be used if not specified or if the column is fixed by the usage.

justify.title: Text justification
justify.description: How to position the text within the row or field.  Left or right justification is against the specified (or default) column.  Center justification centers on the whole row.

events.description:
If specified, this screen will automatically be shown when any of the events listed occurs.  
For example, a screen to show the file transfer progress can automatically be shown when a file transfer starts. 
Note that each event can only trigger one (or no) screen, so if you specify the same event for multiple screens, only the last one in the file will be activated.

menuSetName.description: Name that will be reported to host to check which screen set is installed.    Alphanumeric with no spaces or special characters other than _ (underscore).

language.description: Which language is used on the screens.  This is required to enable special handling for non-ASCII letters.

useMenuArrows.title: Use Menu Arrows?
useMenuArrows.description: If true, left and right arrows will be used to indicate when there are more submenu items that can be accessed through the left and right keys.

leftArrowCode.description: Character code for left arrow for menu navigation.  Suggestions: 127 for left arrow, 60 for ASCII '<'

rightArrowCode.description: Character code for right arrow for menu navigation.  Suggestions: 126 for right arrow, 62 for ASCII '>'

leftRightDataNav.title: Allow left/right navigation of data screens
leftRightDataNav.description: Normally, left/right buttons are used to move between sibling submenus (submenus on the same level below a common parent menu), and up/down buttons are used to scroll through a list of data screens under a leaf menu.  If this option is enabled, then the left/right keys will also work, with the same functionality as up/down, for the data screens.

escLktPassOnVacRel.title: Escape leakTestPass screen on vacuum release
escLktPassOnVacRel.description:
If the leakTestPass showOnEvent is used to transition to a screen upon passing the leak test, that same screen will be "Escaped" (the equivalent of pressing the Esc key) when the vacuum from the test is released. 

This can be combined with the ackRequired flag and an EscAction to showModeScreen to show the pass screen as long as the vacuum still exists, and then automatically switch to the mode screen when the vacuum is released.

thousandsChar.title: Thousands separator
thousandsChar.description: Express 1234 as 1,234 (US), 1.234 (Germany) or 1 234 (Sweden) for variables that have the option of showing a thousands separator.

chirpMsecs.title: Chirp length
chirpMsecs.description:
Sets the time duration of the chirp in milliseconds.  The chirp happens when a navigation key can't execute its function such as when trying to move beyond the beginning or end of a non-wrapping list, or pressing the Enter key on a screen that doesn't support it (e.g.- a data screen). 

The default is 10 milliseconds.  Zero disables the chirp.

autoAckSecs.title: Automatic screen acknowledgement timer
autoAckSecs.description:
For screens that require the Esc key be pressed to acknowledge that you have seen it before it switches to another screen, this timer allows the Ack requirement to time out and allow the screen to change without an Esc press.  Set to zero to disable the timeout and always require an Esc press.

For example, if set to 5 then if the Leak Test Fail screen has an `ackRequired`, the screen will be released in 5 seconds without a press.  It will then change as soon as some event or condition triggers switching to a new screen.

minFwVersion.title: Minimum Opus FW version
minFwVersion.description: This version or later is required to be able to parse all the features of this JSON schema.

schemaVersion.title: Menu file JSON schema version
schemaVersion.description: This defines the JSON data structure that this file conforms to, set by the standard reference file referred to in "$schema"

menuFileRev.title: Menu File Revision
menuFileRev.description: Single integer revision number for this menu file.  You may use whatever numbering scheme you like.  The host may use this to determine if the installed file needs to be updated.

menuStringSet.title: String replacements
menuStringSet.description:
Optional replacement or translated text for default English strings to describe bench states, for example.  For any that are not specified, the default English will be used.

Note that some strings have shorter max lengths in order to leave room for an associated countdown timer.

unknownStr.title: Unknown mode label
unknownStr.description: Optional text to replace "Unknown" to describe when the bench is in an uknown state.

bootingStr.title: Booting mode label
bootingStr.description: Optional text to replace "Boot Up" to describe when the bench is in the boot state.

inProgressStr.title: In Progress label
inProgressStr.description: Optional text to replace "In Progress" to go before the state countdown timers.

serviceStr.title: Service mode label
serviceStr.description: Optional text to replace "Service" to describe when the bench is in the service state.

periphOffStr.title: Peripherals Off label
periphOffStr.description: Optional text to replace "Peripherals Off" to describe the submode when the peripherals are being turned off.

condTrapFullStr.title: Condensate Trap Full label
condTrapFullStr.description: Optional text to replace "Cond. Trap Full" to describe the service submode when the condensate trap is full and needs to be emptied.

leakTestReqdStr.title: Leak Test Required label
leakTestReqdStr.description: Optional text to replace "Leak Test Required" to describe the service submode when a leak test is required.

readyStr.title: Ready mode label
readyStr.description: Optional text to replace "Ready" to describe when the bench is in the full readiness state.

almostReadyStr.title: Almost Ready mode label
almostReadyStr.description: Optional text to replace "Almost Ready" to describe when the bench is in the readiness state with some submode such as warming or rinsing.

warmupStr.title: Warmup label
warmupStr.description: Optional text to replace "Warm Up" to describe the readiness submode when the bench is still warming up.

rinsingStr.title: Rinsing label
rinsingStr.description: Optional text to replace "Rinsing" to describe when the bench is in the rinsing state.

measuringStr.title: Measurement mode label
measuringStr.description: Optional text to replace "Measurement" to describe when the bench is in the measurement mode.

zeroingStr.title: Zeroing label
zeroingStr.description: Optional text to replace "Zeroing" to describe when the bench is in the zeroing state.

zeroDriftStr.title: Zero Drift Check label
zeroDriftStr.description: Optional text to replace "Zero Drift Check" to describe when the bench is in the zeroing state with the added daily zero drift test.

zeroSpanCheckStr.title: Span Check / Preparing label
zeroSpanCheckStr.description: Optional text to replace "Preparing" to describe when the bench is performing the span check and preparing the pumps at the end of the zeroing sequence.

errorModeStr.title: Error mode label
errorModeStr.description: Optional text to replace "Error State" to describe when the bench is in the error state.

standbyStr.title: Standby mode label
standbyStr.description: Optional text to replace "Standby" to describe when the bench is in the standby state.

updateLrStr.title: Update LR label
updateLrStr.description: Optional text to replace "Update LR" to describe when the bench is receiving new legally relevant controller firmware.

updateNlrStr.title: Update NLR label
updateNlrStr.description: Optional text to replace "Update NLR" to describe when the bench is receiving new non-legally relevant controller firmware.

updateBothStr.title: Update Both label
updateBothStr.description: Optional text to replace "Update Both" to describe when the bench is receiving new legally and non-legally relevant controller firmware.

updateSensorStr.title: Update Sensor label
updateSensorStr.description: Optional text to replace "Update Sensor" to describe when the bench is receiving new particle sensor board firmware.

loadingFileStr.title: Bench update Loading File label
loadingFileStr.description: Optional text to replace "Loading File" to describe when the bench is receiving new firmware and is loading the file.

updatingFwStr.title: Updating firmware label
updatingFwStr.description: Optional text to replace "Updating" to describe when the bench has received new firmware and is in the process of updating it by writing it to flash.

doneRstStr.title: Done - Reset label
doneRstStr.description: Optional text to replace "Done, Will Reset" to describe when the bench has received new firmware, finished installing it and is rebooting to start the new firmware.

shutdownStr.title: Shutdown mode label
shutdownStr.description: Optional text to replace "Shutdown" to describe when the bench is in the shutdown state.

leakTestModeStr.title: Leak Test mode label
leakTestModeStr.description: Optional text to replace "Leak Test" to describe when the bench is in the leak test state.

lktPrepStr.title: Leak Test - Preparing label
lktPrepStr.description: Optional text to replace "Prepare" to describe when the bench is in the leak test state and the preparation sub-state.

lktTestStr.title: Leak Test - Testing label
lktTestStr.description: Optional text to replace "Testing" to describe when the bench is in the leak test state and the actual test is in progress.

lktPassedStr.title: Leak Test - Passed label
lktPassedStr.description: Optional text to replace "Passed" to describe when the bench is in the leak test state and the test has passed.  This mode is not included in the new Opus managed leak test.

expiredStr.title: Cal/Adj Expired label
expiredStr.description: Optional text to replace "Expired" to describe when the calibration/adjustment validity period has passed.

vacOkStr.title: Leak Test - Vacuum OK label
vacOkStr.description: Optional text to replace "OK" to describe when the vacuum is high enough to meet the requirements for passing a leak test.

vacLowStr.title: Leak Test - Vacuum Low label
vacLowStr.description: Optional text to replace "Low" to describe when the vacuum is below the requirements for passing a leak test.

flowOkStr.title: Leak Test - Flow OK label
flowOkStr.description: Optional text to replace "OK" to describe when the flow rate is low enough to meet the requirements for passing a leak test.

flowHighStr.title: Leak Test - Flow High label
flowHighStr.description: Optional text to replace "High" to describe when the flow rate is too high to pass the leak test.

calSwActiveStr.title: Cal Switch Active Label
calSwActiveStr.description: Optional text to replace "Active" to describe the calibration switch state.  Active means unlocked.

calSwInactiveStr.title: Cal Switch Inactive Label
calSwInactiveStr.description: Optional text to replace "Inactive" to describe the calibration switch state.  Inactive is the normal locked state.

bleConnectedStr.title: BLE Connected String
bleConnectedStr.description: Optional text to replace "Connected" to describe the BLE connected state.

bleUnconnectedStr.title: BLE Unconnected String
bleUnconnectedStr.description: Optional text to replace "Disconnected" to describe the BLE connected state.

blePairedStr.title: BLE Paired String
blePairedStr.description: Optional text to replace "Connected/Paired" to describe the BLE connected and paired state.

bleBondedConnStr.title: BLE Bonded Connection String
bleBondedConnStr.description: Optional text to replace "Connected/Bonded" to describe the BLE connected and bonded state.

hostCabledStr.title: Cable Connection String
hostCabledStr.description: Optional text to replace "RS-485 Cable" to describe the current host connection when it is the RS-485 cable.

hostBLEStr.title: Host BLE Connection String
hostBLEStr.description: Optional text to replace "Bluetooth LE" to describe the current host connection when it is BLE.

hostNCStr.title: Host Inactive String
hostNCStr.description: Optional text to replace "Inactive" to describe the current host connection when there is no activity.

hostControlStr.title: `Host is in control` String
hostControlStr.description: Optional text to replace "Host Controlled" to describe that the host is actively communicating with the PNC.  See the localControlStr for the other possible state.

localControlStr.title: `Local Control` String
localControlStr.description: Optional text to replace "Local Control" to describe that the host is NOT actively communicating with the PNC, so the keypad is control of measurement mode.  See the hostControlStr for the other possible state.

pnValidStr.title: PN Valid String
pnValidStr.description: Optional text to replace "Valid" to describe when the PN value is valid.  Leaving this blank might also be a good choice.  Used by the `pnValidity` state variable.

pnPausedStr.title: PN Paused String
pnPausedStr.description: Optional text to replace "Paused" to describe when the PN value is paused.

pnErrorStr.title: PN Error String
pnErrorStr.description: Optional text to replace "Error" to describe when the PN value is not being displayed due to an error.

pnOutOfRangeStr.title: PN Out of Range String
pnOutOfRangeStr.description: Optional text to replace "Out of Range" to describe when the PN value is either above or below the range where the values are certified for accuracy.
